Stem: Covered in bristly hairs, contain a milky sap.
Leaves: Hairy green leaves up to 15 cm long arranged in rosette close to ground.
Flowers: Yellow dandelion-like flowers with square-ended petals, 3 cm diameter, with single flower per stem. Single red stripe underneath petals.
FruitSeeds: Narrow dark brown seeds with parachuting hairs, in dandelion-like ball.
Habitat: Narrow L-shaped about 2 mm long with parachuting hairs.
DistinguishingFeatures: Bright red stripe under petals distinguishes from flatweeds and other hawkweeds.
Impacts: Major threat through competition to endangered alpine flora (and subsequently) fauna, unpalatable to livestock.
